CatDescriptText: Mike Middow, 5112 Barlew Street and Robert T. Jones, 417 N. Aiken Avenue were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 14, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that the City of Pittsburgh should own and operate its transportation system (street cars and buses)?" Mike Middow's answer reads: "Yes, the city should. There has been so much trouble that you have to take a taxicab or other means of transportation to work, therefore you are practically working for nothing."  Robert T. Jones' answer reads: "Yes, I do.  The city should own it outright.  I've lived in cities like New York, where that is the case, and I might say that if Pittsburgh owned the transportation system, I don't think there would be trouble like we have almost every two years here."
TitMainTitle: Mike Middow wearing light colored hat, houndstooth shirt, plaid coat, and holding light colored bag, and Robert T. Jones, standing in front of granite pillar with double glass doors on either side
